creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
If you temporarily rename iconv.h in /usr/local/include and "make clean && make"
does the issue go away?

Dear Joe,

Wow - I bow before you cause you are a legend!

It worked smooth without the iconv.h header in /usr/local/include.
What is wrong going if it it present?

Thanks and may the force be with you!

Regards, Jan
creator: rasche@xcommunycationz.com
jorton@redhat.com
text:
GNU libiconv.h does "#define iconv libiconv_open"; apr-util thinks it is using
the libc iconv() but actually it ends up using libiconv but without linking
against -liconv.

If -I/usr/local/include is getting picked up gratuitously then this is possible
to fix; if -I/usr/local/include is getting picked up for some good reason at
some point through the configure script, there's no chance of fixing this really.

Can you attach (and really *attach*, not in-line :) the full output from the
configure command?

creator: rasche@xcommunycationz.com
text:
Created attachment 10741
Dear Joe, here comes the output from the failing compilation with the /usr/local/incluse/iconv.h . Thank you very much for you awesome advice helping out of this loop! Regards, Jan

creator: rasche@xcommunycationz.com
text:
Dear Joe,

Should we close this bug?

Thank you!

Jan

Yes, I suppose... it's an instance of the issue that changing compiler flags in
the middle of a configure script effectively invalidates the results of all the
tests that have been previously carried out.  But thanks for reporting it anyway.
creator: jorton@redhat.com
